org.jboss.windup.config

Class Variables

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jboss.windup.config.Variables

  • @Vetoed
public class Variables
extends Object
    A variables stack - keeps few layers of "key"->[vertices] maps, one per rule execution level, Iteration and RuleSubset.
    Author:
    Lincoln Baxter, III

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <FRAMETYPE extends WindupVertexFrame> 
      FRAMETYPE      		 findSingletonVariable(Class<FRAMETYPE> type, String name)
      Type-safe wrapper around findVariable(String) returns a unique WindupVertexFrame.
      <T extends WindupVertexFrame> 
      T      		 findSingletonVariable(String name)
      Wrapper around findVariable(String) which gives only one framed vertex, and checks if there is 0 or 1; throws otherwise.
      Iterable<WindupVertexFrame> findVariable(String name)
      Searches the variables layers, top to bottom, for given name, and returns if found; null otherwise.
      Iterable<WindupVertexFrame> findVariableOfType(Class<?> type)
      Searches the variables layers, top to bottom, for the iterable having all of it's items of the given type.
      static Variables instance(GraphRewrite event)
      Gets an instance from a OCP rewrite context.
      Map<String,Iterable<WindupVertexFrame>> peek()
      Get the top Variables layer from the stack.
      Map<String,Iterable<WindupVertexFrame>> pop()
      Remove the top Variables layer from the the stack.

      Add new Variables layer on top of the stack.
      void removeVariable(String name)
      Remove a variable in the top variables layer.
      void setSingletonVariable(String string, WindupVertexFrame frame)
      Type-safe wrapper around setVariable which sets only one framed vertex.
      void setVariable(String name, Iterable<WindupVertexFrame> frames)
      Set a variable in the top variables layer to given "collection" of the vertex frames.

      • setSingletonVariable

        public void setSingletonVariable(String string,
                        WindupVertexFrame frame)
        Type-safe wrapper around setVariable which sets only one framed vertex.

      • setVariable

        public void setVariable(String name,
               Iterable<WindupVertexFrame> frames)
        Set a variable in the top variables layer to given "collection" of the vertex frames. Can't be reassigned - throws on attempt to reassign.

      • removeVariable

        public void removeVariable(String name)
        Remove a variable in the top variables layer.

      • findSingletonVariable

        public <T extends WindupVertexFrame> T findSingletonVariable(String name)
        Wrapper around findVariable(String) which gives only one framed vertex, and checks if there is 0 or 1; throws otherwise.

      • findSingletonVariable

        public <FRAMETYPE extends WindupVertexFrame> FRAMETYPE findSingletonVariable(Class<FRAMETYPE> type,
                                                                    String name)
        Type-safe wrapper around findVariable(String) returns a unique WindupVertexFrame.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If more than one frame was found.

      • findVariable

        public Iterable<WindupVertexFrame> findVariable(String name)
        Searches the variables layers, top to bottom, for given name, and returns if found; null otherwise.

      • findVariableOfType

        public Iterable<WindupVertexFrame> findVariableOfType(Class<?> type)
        Searches the variables layers, top to bottom, for the iterable having all of it's items of the given type. Return null if not found.
